III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Compliance with the child protection law
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12214
Section • (1) An agency shall comply with the child protection law,
Description 1975 PA 238, MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A 13- and 16-year-old youth engaged in sexual intercourse in their
placement and the facility did not respond to the incident. Oakland
County DHHS was made aware and failed to report the incident.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed on 8/14/2024 via phone. She
reported she went to the Sanctuary on 8/9/2024 for a visit and
while interviewing a youth she was informed that Youth A, age 16
and Youth B, age 13 were engaged in sexual intercourse at the
facility and staff did not do anything about it. The Complainant
reported she asked the Program Manager about the allegation,
and he confirmed this incident did happen. The Complainant
reported she was not certain the agency completed an incident
report. The complainant reported the Program Manager of the
agency reported to her that several conversations were held by
the agency, Sanctuary, and Oakland County DHHS about calling
the incident into centralized intake. The Complainant reported she
did not believe neither agency reported this allegation into
centralize intake.
It should be noted that SI#2024SIC0001687 was opened the
same time as this investigation regarding the same incident on
The Sanctuary.
Chief Administrator was informed of the allegation via phone
and email on 8/12/2024. He did not provide any information.
Staff 1 for Sanctuary was interviewed on 8/22/2024 via phone
in collaboration with another DHHS Worker. She reported her
employment ended at the facility on 8/11/2024. She said she
found out that Youth A and Youth B engaged in sex by reading
Youth B’s journal. She said she read that Youth B gave Youth A,
“a blow job.” She reported she believes this incident occurred
around 7/12/2024. She had no information to report about
Oakland County DHHS.
2

Program Manager of Sanctuary was interviewed on 9/16/2024
via phone. He reported when he was informed of the incident in
August 2024, he reported the information to the DHHS Worker
who was completing an investigation on Youth A’s parental home
and who came to the facility to interview Youth A. He reported
DHHS Worker told him the allegations needed to be reported. He
confirmed the only person he communicated with pertaining to
these incidents were DHHS Worker.
DHHS Worker is not an employee under the Child Placing Agency
license.
DHHS Worker was interviewed on 9/16/2024 and 10/8/2024 via
phone. She confirmed she spoke with Sanctuary pertaining to the
allegations and no one else from Oakland County DHHS was
involved.
Analysis It was reported that Oakland County DHHS learned of allegations
of abuse and/or neglect and did not report per child protection law.
However, no employee under the Child Placing Agency license is
involved and therefore, Oakland County DHHS is in compliance.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.

sir_summary.summary: A 13-year-old and a 16-year-old in a licensed placement engaged in sexual intercourse, but the investigation found that Oakland County DHHS, as a licensed Child Placing Agency, did not violate reporting rules because the DHHS employee who was informed of the incident was not an employee under that specific license. The report concludes that no violation was established. The lack of substantiated violation hinges on a technical distinction between employees, not on whether the incident was reported.
